name: A1
recipe: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass.

name: ABC
recipe: Layered in a shot glass.

name: Ace
recipe: Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass.

name: Adam
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: AT&T
recipe: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

name: ACID
recipe: Poor in the 151 first followed by the 101 served with a Coke or Dr Pepper chaser.

name: A. J.
recipe: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Affair
recipe: Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.

name: Apello
recipe: Stirr. Grnish with maraschino cherry.

name: Avalon
recipe: Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

name: Abilene
recipe: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

name: Almeria
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Addison
recipe: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

name: Acapulco
recipe: Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

name: Affinity
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Applecar
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Aviation
recipe: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Alexander
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Algonquin
recipe: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Allegheny
recipe: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Artillery
recipe: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Afterglow
recipe: Mix. Serve over ice.

name: Autodafé
recipe: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.

name: Afternoon
recipe: Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.

name: After sex
recipe: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar

name: B-53
recipe: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52

name: B-52
recipe: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

name: Bijou
recipe: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

name: Boxcar
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

name: Big Red
recipe: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass

name: Bellini
recipe: Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

name: Bramble
recipe: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

name: Balmoral
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Bluebird
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.

name: Brooklyn
recipe: Combine ingredients with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Boomerang
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

name: Bora Bora
recipe: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.

name: Barracuda
recipe: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

name: Buccaneer
recipe: Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently

name: Brigadier
recipe: Mix ingredients in a warmed mug and stir.

name: Broadside
recipe: Half fill the glass with ice cubes. Crush the wormwood and add to ice. Pour rum, scotch and butters, then serve!

name: Blackthorn
recipe: Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Bob Marley
recipe: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

name: Bumble Bee
recipe: This is a layered shot. First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass. Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass. Carefully add the Kahlua. Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!

name: Bubble Gum
recipe: Layer in order into a shot glass.

name: Bible Belt
recipe: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice.

name: Brain Fart
recipe: Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.

name: Bloody Mary
recipe: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

name: Blue Lagoon
recipe: Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.

name: Boston Sour
recipe: Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

name: Casino
recipe: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

name: Caipirinha
recipe: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cachaça.

name: Cherry Rum
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cuba Libre
recipe: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Cuba Libra
recipe: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!

name: Cafe Savoy
recipe: Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.

name: Cream Soda
recipe: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.

name: Corn n Oil
recipe: Cut the half lime in half again. Add the lime, falernum, and bitters to a rocks glass. Muddle. Add the rum. (Aged Barbados rum such as Plantation 5 Year is recommended). Add ice and stir. Float the blackstrap rum on top. Serve with a straw.

name: Casa Blanca
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Clover Club
recipe: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

name: Citrus Coke
recipe: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

name: Chicago Fizz
recipe: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

name: City Slicker
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Coffee-Vodka
recipe: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

name: Caipirissima
recipe: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!

name: Campari Beer
recipe: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.

name: Cosmopolitan
recipe: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

name: Casino Royale
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

name: Clove Cocktail
recipe: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coffee Liqueur
recipe: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

name: Chocolate Milk
recipe: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

name: Coke and Drops
recipe: Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

name: Corpse Reviver
recipe: Shake, strain, straight up, cocktail glass rinsed with absinthe

name: Chocolate Drink
recipe: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.

name: Creme de Menthe
recipe: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

name: Derby
recipe: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

name: Diesel
recipe: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

name: Daiquiri
recipe: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

name: Danbooka
recipe: pour it in and mix it.

name: Dragonfly
recipe: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Downshift
recipe: Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.

name: Dry Rob Roy
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Dry Martini
recipe: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

name: Dirty Nipple
recipe: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top

name: Dirty Martini
recipe:
Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.
Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.
Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.
A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

name: Darkwood Sling
recipe: There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

name: Dark Caipirinha
recipe:
Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaca into the glass.
Stir well.

name: Duchamp's Punch
recipe:
Shake all ingredients.
Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube.
Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

name: Dark and Stormy
recipe: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Damned if you do
recipe: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

name: Dubonnet Cocktail
recipe: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Drinking Chocolate
recipe: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.

name: Death in the Afternoon
recipe: Easy as you like, pour the absinthe into a chilled glass, top with champagne. Must be drunk mid afternoon for the optimum effect.

name: Egg Cream
recipe: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.

name: Egg Nog #4
recipe: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

name: English Highball
recipe: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

name: Espresso Martini
recipe: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

name: Espresso Rumtini
recipe: Mix together in a cocktail glass. Garnish with some choclate powder and coffee beans

name: Egg Nog - Healthy
recipe: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

name: English Rose Cocktail
recipe: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

name: Elderflower Caipirinha
recipe: Take the glass and muddle the lime in it. Fill the glass with crushed ice and add the Cachaca. Stir well and top with some more crushed ice. Garnish with lime and enjoy!

name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked
recipe: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

name: Empellón Cocina's Fat-Washed Mezcal
recipe:
To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here’s their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you’ll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and purée until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you’re having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you’ve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don’t have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don’t have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.

name: Frappé
recipe: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

name: Foxy Lady
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: French 75
recipe: Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

name: Frisco Sour
recipe: Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.

name: Fruit Shake
recipe: Blend til smooth.

name: Figgy Thyme
recipe: In a lewis bag, crush up some ice like a baller/maniac (@glacioice). Pour your precious ice into a collins glass. In a cocktail shaker, muddle the figs and thyme together. Add honey vodka, lemon juice, and a large ice cube (@glacioice). Shake until well chilled, and strain into glass. Add tonic water and finally 2 dashes of angostura bitters. Garnish with sliced figs and thyme.

name: Fruit Cooler
recipe: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.

name: Freddy Kruger
recipe: make it an ample size shot!!

name: Fuzzy Asshole
recipe: fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.

name: Funk and Soul
recipe: Mix all ingredients together and strain into a Collins glass. Use Jamaican rum where possible for a more authentic taste.

name: French Martini
recipe: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

name: French Negroni
recipe:
Add ice to a shaker and pour in all ingredients.
Using a bar spoon, stir 40 to 45 revolutions or until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a martini glass or over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Flying Dutchman
recipe: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

name: Frozen Daiquiri
recipe: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.

name: Fruit Flip-Flop
recipe: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

name: Fahrenheit 5000
recipe: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

name: Flying Scotchman
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: French Connection
recipe: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Flaming Dr. Pepper
recipe: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

name: Flander's Flake-Out
recipe: Bang 'em both in.

name: Flaming Lamborghini
recipe: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

name: Frozen Mint Daiquiri
recipe: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.

name: Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri
recipe: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: GG
recipe: Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.

name: Gimlet
recipe:
Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.

Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Gin Fizz
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

name: Gin Sour
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

name: Godchild
recipe: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

name: Gin Daisy
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

name: Gin Sling
recipe: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

name: Gin Smash
recipe: Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.

name: Gin Toddy
recipe: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Godfather
recipe: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Godmother
recipe: Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.

name: Gagliardo
recipe: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

name: Gluehwein
recipe: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.

name: Greyhound
recipe:
Add the vodka to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with grapefruit juice and stir.

name: Gin Cooler
recipe: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.

name: Gin Squirt
recipe: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

name: Grand Blue
recipe: Serve in an old fashioned glass.

name: Gin Rickey
recipe: Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

name: Gin Swizzle
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

name: Grass Skirt
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: Grim Reaper
recipe: Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.

name: Grasshopper
recipe: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Grizzly Bear
recipe: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.

name: Green Goblin
recipe: Cider First, Lager then Curacao

name: Golden dream
recipe: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

name: H.D.
recipe: Mix the whisky and Baileys Cream in a beer-glass (at least 50 cl). Fill the rest of the glass with coffee.

name: Honey Bee
recipe: Shake ingredients with crushed ice

name: Hot Toddy
recipe:
STEP 1
Whisk the whisky and honey together and split between 2 heatproof glasses. Add half of the cinnamon stick to each, then top up with 200ml boiling water.

STEP 2
Add a splash of lemon juice to each, then taste and add more to your preference. Finish each with a slice of lemon, studded with a clove, and serve immediately.

name: Herbal flame
recipe: Pour Hot Damn 100 in bottom of a jar or regular glass. Fill the rest of the glass with sweet tea. Stir with spoon, straw, or better yet a cinnamon stick and leave it in.

name: Horse's Neck
recipe: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

name: Happy Skipper
recipe: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)

name: Hunter's Moon
recipe: Put the Bombay Sapphire, Martini Bianco, sugar syrup & blackberries in a cocktail shaker with lots of ice and shake vigorously before pouring into a balloon glass, topping up with lemonade and garnishing with a wedge of orange.

name: Havana Cocktail
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Holloween Punch
recipe: Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.

name: Hot Creamy Bush
recipe: Combine all ingredients in glass

name: Homemade Kahlua
recipe: Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.

name: Halloween Punch
recipe:
Tip the cherry juice, orange peel, chilli, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger into a large saucepan. Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 4 hrs, or up to 2 days – the longer you leave it the more intense the flavours. If serving to young children, take the chilli out after a few hours.

When you’re ready to serve, pour the juice into a jug. Serve in glass bottles or glasses and pop a straw in each. If you're adding vodka, do so at this stage. Dangle a fangs sweet from each glass.

name: Harvey Wallbanger
recipe: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

name: Hawaiian Cocktail
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Hemingway Special
recipe: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.

name: Highland Fling Cocktail
recipe: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

name: Hot Chocolate to Die for
recipe: Melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla in a double boiler. When just smooth stir in the cream.

name: Ipamena
recipe: Cut half a lime into pieces, place in a shaker, add the sugar and crush. Measure the passion fruit juice, add it to the shaker and fill up with ice cubes. Close the shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the liquid into a glass, top up with ginger ale, stir with a teaspoon and then garnish the rim of the glass with a slice of lime

name: Ice Pick
recipe: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.

name: Iced Coffee
recipe: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.

name: Irish Cream
recipe: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.

name: Irish Spring
recipe: Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.

name: Irish Coffee
recipe: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.

name: Imperial Fizz
recipe: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

name: Irish Russian
recipe: Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.

name: Imperial Cocktail
recipe: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Iced Coffee Fillip
recipe: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.

name: Irish Curdling Cow
recipe: Pour Irish Cream, Vodka, and Bourbon in a glass. Add some ice and mix in the orange juice.

name: Jitterbug
recipe: Wet glass, dip rim in sugar. Then add Ice. Then add everything else. It's that simple!

name: Jam Donut
recipe: Coat the rim of a shot glass with sugar using sugar syrup to stick. Add the Chambord raspberry liqueur to the shot glass, and carefully layer the Baileys Irish Cream on top. Serve.

name: Jelly Bean
recipe: mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!

name: Jackhammer
recipe: Serve over ice- Warning,Deadly!

name: Jello shots
recipe: Boil 3 cups of water then add jello. Mix jello and water until jello is completely disolved. Add the two cups of vodka and mix together. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill until firm. Then, eat away...

name: John Collins
recipe: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

name: Jamaica Kiss
recipe: Fill a tumbler with ice cubes. Add a shot of Tia Maria and a shot of Jamaican light rum. Fill the tumbler with milk. Blend until smooth and serve immediately.

name: Japanese Fizz
recipe: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

name: Just a Moonmint
recipe: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

name: Jamaican Coffee
recipe: Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.

name: Jewel Of The Nile
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Jack Rose Cocktail
recipe: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Jack's Vanilla Coke
recipe: After pouring in your ingredients, and adding 3-5 ice cubes, according to taste. Stir the drink with a stirrer to get the Vanilla off the bottom.

name: Kir
recipe: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

name: Karsk
recipe: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.

name: Kamikaze
recipe: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

name: Kir Royale
recipe: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top

name: Kurant Tea
recipe: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!

name: Kiwi Lemon
recipe: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.

name: Kioki Coffee
recipe: Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.

name: Kool-Aid Shot
recipe: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.

name: Kiss me Quick
recipe: mix in the glass

name: Kool First Aid
recipe: Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

name: Kentucky B And B
recipe: Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.

name: Kentucky Colonel
recipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Kool-Aid Slammer
recipe: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

name: Kiwi Papaya Smoothie
recipe: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

name: Kill the cold Smoothie
recipe: Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.

name: Limeade
recipe: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.

name: Lunch Box
recipe: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

name: Lemon Shot
recipe: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

name: Long vodka
recipe: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka

name: Lemon Drop
recipe: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

name: Loch Lomond
recipe: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
